Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2010 05:46PM kim1967 wrote: I am so sorry you have joined the "club".  It is very overwhelming in the beginning,  I had my bi-lateral mast. in July 2009, and just had my exchange surgery last week.  4 rounds of chemo, but no rads.  It's not something I would have choosen to do, and it has been hard - I hope to encourage you by saying it is managable.  My perspective of the mastectomy was much worse than the reality.  You can do this, but if you haven't already ask your Dr. about a prescription for Ativan.  It has been a life saver to help me manage this journey.  If you haven't found it yet, there is also another wonderful board (like this one) at www.youngsurvival.org   Good luck tomorrow, and let me know if I can answer any questions.
